mentions.context: SelectkBest method then ranks the feature vectors based on F-scores returned by the f_regression method.

SelectkBest (Pedregosa et al., 2011) is a filter-based, univariate feature selection method intended to select and retain first k-best features based on the scores produced by univariate statistical tests.
method from SciPy library (Virtanen et al., 2020).
Signal Processing sub-module (scipy.signal) of SciPy library (Virtanen et al., 2020) in python was used to compute the band power feature.
Signal Processing sub-module (scipy.signal) of SciPy library (Virtanen et al., 2020) in python was used to compute the band power feature.
These feature matrices were then ranked using the SelectKBest feature selection method.
These feature column vectors serve as input for the SelectKBest algorithm for performing feature selection and ranking for all three datasets.

The electrodes were ranked for the three datasets using the SelectKBest method, as discussed in Section 2.4, and the ranks are tabulated for valence and arousal labels in Table 2. To produce a ranking for Top N electrodes, feature data for top N electrodes were initially considered.

In this work, the following set of 36 features was extracted from the EEG signal data with the help of EEGExtract library (Saba-Sadiya et al., 2020) for all three datasets: These features were extracted with a 1 s sliding window and no overlap.
The number of spikes was computed by finding local minima or peaks in EEG signal over seven samples using scipy.signal.find_peaks
In this experiment, a random forest regressor was implemented with 100 tree estimators and squared-error criterion as base parameters using the sci-kit learn library.

In this work, initially, zero-variance or constant features were eliminated from the set of 36 extracted EEG features using the VarianceThreshold feature selection method using sci-kit learn package (Pedregosa et al., 2011).
